data.title: Dave McKean Short Film night - What's On
data.meta_description: Grab your opportunity to spend a night in the company of renowned  English illustrator, photographer, comic book artist, graphic designer, filmmaker and musician, Dave McKean.
data.text:
*Please read our important information about our Covid-19 safety precautions before visiting.*

An evening of short works and clips, introduced and discussed by director, writer and illustrator Dave McKean, including a couple of big screen premieres, and mostly focussed on the combination of film and music.

McKean has collaborated with Neil Gaiman on an array of film and book projects, and illustrated works on subjects including Heston Blumenthal, John Cale and The Rolling Stones.

With a number of Harry Potter films to his name, as conceptual artist, McKean has also directed many of his own films, including Mirrormask.

McKean has also designed stamps for the Royal Mail, worked on a range of comics and graphic novels, and produced album artwork for bands including Paradise Lost, Machine Head, Fear Factory, and Counting Crows.

Join us for this very special opportunity to hear Dave discuss his body of work, and take part in a Q&A with the audience.

FIRST HALF:

Mixed Metaphors - from Nine Lives - 3min

Emilia Martensson - Loredana - 6min

Visitors - 9min

Close To You - from Mirrormask - 4min

Cathedral of Trees - from Nine Lives - 7min

Maggid Street - with Iain Sinclair - 15min

SECOND HALF:

Buckethead - Ballad of Buckethead - 4min

Whack! - 15min

Stian Carstensen - Hippocampus Serenade - 7min

Izzy - Una Furtiva Lagrima - 4min

Words - from Luna - 4min

Entertaining Mr Stone - Anticipation - 4min

END
